newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends lower, world production cited.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends lower, world production cited.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures ended lower amid pressure from the International Grains Council's upwardly revised estimate of 1996 world wheat production, traders said.
On Friday, the IGC pegged wheat production at 563 million tonnes, up from its previous forecast of 560 million tonnes.
Traders also said sagging values in CBOT corn and soybeans spilled over and pressured KCBT wheat.
KCBT wheat had been mostly lower at the midsession, although the nearby September contract had seen a boost from the lack of deliveries posted Friday.
KCBT wheat closed 1-1/4 to six cents per bushel lower, with Sept down 1-1/4 cents at $4.67-1/2. Dec shed 2-1/2 cents to close at $4.68-1/2.
The Kansas City Board of Trade will be closed Monday in observance of the Labor Day holiday. Traders said the imminent long weekend kept volumes mostly light Friday.
General Mills reportedly bull-spread one million Sept/Dec bushels. Refco, Continental and Benson Quinn each bull-spread at least 500,000 Sept/Dec, traders said.
The KCBT estimated Friday's volume at 28.55 million bushels, far less than Thursday's 48.655 million bushels.
